snippet: The State Department was expected to apply the designation to two groups and an individual, the first formal accusations of responsibility for the 2012 attack that left an American ambassador dead.
abstract: State Department is moving to apply the terrorist designation to two Libyan organizations and one militant believed to have played a role in the deadly attack on the American diplomatic mission in Benghazi in September 2012; terrorist designations would be the American government’s first formal public accusations of responsibility for the attack, which killed Ambassador J Christopher Stevens and three other Americans.
lead_paragraph: The State Department was expected to apply the designation to two groups and an individual, the first formal accusations of responsibility for the 2012 attack that left an American ambassador dead.

headline.main: U.S. to List Libyan Groups and Militant Tied to Benghazi Attack as Terrorists
headline.print_headline: U.S. to List Libyan and Groups Tied to ’12 Attack as Terrorists

keywords.name: persons
keywords.value: Qumu, Abu Sufian Ibrahim Ahmed Hamuda bin
